p: Between January 1, 2012 and April 1, 2018, 296 patients underwent ileostomy because of ulcerative colitis (UC: 33.4%), Crohn's disease (CD: 21.6%), carcinoma (24.7%), and other diagnoses (20.3%). Emergency procedures accounted for 33.8% of all operations. The median age at the time of operation was 50 years (15â€“83). 42.2% of the patients were female. BMI was 23.9 m 2/kg (13.8-45.1) and most patients were categorized ASA 1 and 2 (78.7%). 41 of 296 patients developed a HOS (13.9%). The mortality rate was 0.3% ( Table 1).
